articles.author: KAREEM CHEHAYEB, WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Israel's military announced Sunday it is now taking aim at the Lebanon-based Hezbollah's financial arm and will attack a “large number of targets” in Beirut and elsewhere. Explosions began in Beirut's southern suburbs about an hour later.
articles.title: Israel says it will target Hezbollah's financial arm and begins striking Beirut

articles.author: COLLEEN LONG and WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: JONESBORO, Ga. (AP) — Kamala Harris on Sunday summoned Black churchgoers to turn out at the polls and got a big assist from music legend Stevie Wonder, who rallied congregants with a rendition of Bob Marley’s “Redemption Song."
articles.title: Harris urges Black churchgoers in Georgia to head out to vote and gets an assist from Stevie Wonder

articles.author: MATT BROWN
articles.description: LIVONIA, Mich. (AP) — Standing before hundreds of people in a suburban Detroit chapel, at an event organized by Donald Trump's campaign, Marlin J. Reed declared that God had called on them to vote for the former president.
articles.title: Trump boosts a hard-right Christian worldview that paints the election as 'spiritual warfare'

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE and MARC LEVY
articles.description: FEASTERVILLE-TREVOSE, Pa. (AP) — Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump manned the fry station at a McDonald's in Pennsylvania on Sunday before staging an impromptu news conference, answering questions through the drive-thru window.
articles.title: Trump works the fry station and holds a drive-thru news conference at a Pennsylvania McDonald's

articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — Hurricane Oscar has made landfall in eastern Cuba, an island beleaguered by a massive power outage, after striking the southeastern Bahamas earlier in the day Sunday, the U.S.
articles.title: Hurricane Oscar makes landfall in eastern Cuba after striking the Bahamas

articles.author: BY AYANNA ALEXANDER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Left-leaning voter engagement groups that saw a surge in support and energy after Vice President Kamala Harris replaced President Joe Biden as the Democrats' White House nominee are aligning with a key pillar of her campaign in the final stretch before Election Day — trying to turn out uncommitted voters of color.
articles.title: Voting groups that got a boost from Harris' candidacy are still working to persuade voters of color

articles.author: MARTHA BELLISLE
articles.description: Two crew members who were missing following the crash of a fighter jet in mountainous terrain in Washington state during a routine training flight have been declared dead, the U.S.
articles.title: 2 Navy aviators are declared dead after a fighter jet crashed in Washington state

articles.author: JIM MORRIS
articles.description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia (AP) — India’s high commissioner to Canada has denied any involvement in the murder of a Canadian Sikh leader who was killed in British Columbia last year even though the Canadian government has named him as a person of interest in the assassination.
articles.title: Expelled Indian high commissioner denies involvement in murder of Sikh leader in Canada

articles.author: RUSS BYNUM and EMILY WAGSTER PETTUS
articles.description: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) — Georgia authorities said Sunday they are investigating the “catastrophic failure” of a dock gangway that collapsed and killed seven people on an island off the state's Atlantic seacoast, where crowds gathered for a celebration by the island’s tiny Gullah-Geechee community of Black slave descendants.
articles.title: Georgia authorities investigating a dock gangway collapse that killed 7 on a historic island

articles.author: MEG KINNARD
articles.description: One of the late golf legend Arnold Palmer's daughters calls Donald Trump's references to her father's genitalia “a poor choice of approaches" to honoring his memory, adding that she wasn't upset by the remarks.
articles.title: Arnold Palmer's daughter reacts to Donald Trump's references to her father
